excerpt: The Bear, Countdown, The Gilded Age, Ironheart, Squid Game and more! Find out what's new, returning and leaving the small screen this week.

html:
To help you anticipate and navigate all that television has to offer across broadcast, cable and streaming, TVLine offers daily, weekly and monthly What to Watch digests, as well as an overview of every new TV show premiering in 2025.

This week, youâ€™ll find a six series premieres (including Jensen Ackles in Countdown and Marvelâ€™s Ironheart), eight returning shows (including new seasons of The Bear and The Gilded Age) and 11 finales (including the very last episode of Squid Game).

Want scoop on any of the following shows? Email usÂ and your question may be answered in Mattâ€™s Inside Line.

SUNDAY, JUNE 22

The six-part docuseries follows the first generation of kids raised in the social media spotlight over five years, with exclusive access to top creators.

ðŸ“º 10 pm Relative Secrets Season 1 finale (BBC America)

ðŸŽ¥ Barbara Walters Tell Me Everything (Hulu documentary)
The film offers an intimate look at Waltersâ€™ life, career and the challenges she faced as a woman in a male-dominated industry.

TUESDAY, JUNE 24

ðŸ“º 9 pm Ironheart (Disney+, three-episode premiere)

The film is centeredÂ on theÂ personal experiences of caregivers providing for loved ones â€” including EP Bradley Cooper and narrator Uzo Aduba.

The film explores transgender identity and legacy, chronicling the divergent paths of iconic pioneers April Ashley, Amanda Lear and others.

WEDNESDAY, JUNE 25

ðŸ“º Countdown (Prime Video, three-episode premiere)
When a Department of Homeland Security officer is murdered, an LAPD detective (Jensen Ackles) is recruited to a secret task force to investigate.

THURSDAY, JUNE 26

ðŸ“º Butchers of L.A. (Sundance Now, three-episode binge)
The docuseries focuses on Patrick Kearney, William Bonin and Randy Kraft, predators who targeted young men in southern California over two decades.

ðŸ“º Nelly and Ashanti: We Belong Together (Peacock, eight-episode binge)
The titular couple rekindle their love, navigate the ups and downs of being newlyweds and new parents, and juggle their careers.

FRIDAY, JUNE 27

ðŸ“º Smoke (Apple TV+, two-episode premiere)
A troubled detective (Jurnee Smollett) and an enigmatic arson investigator (Taron Egerton) pursue the trails of two serial arsonists.

After a deadly viral outbreak, a group of orphans flee in search of a new life, only to be taken hostage by a woman (Michelle Dockery) hiding a sinister secret.Â

What are you watching this week? Take stock of everything above, then drop a comment with your lists below.
